result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on November 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

UNSIGNED
Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property. 
Pick up personal belongings with police escort. 
Comply with day reporting requirements-GPS

4:51 PM Defendant Benaiah Aaron Appleton appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Claudia T. Johnson appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin. Defendant is public defender eligible and is awaiting appointment. Defendant requests a court appointment of counsel at this time. Court addresses bond, defendant made the request at last weeks STC. State is in compliance w/victim's rights. Defendant is requesting a signature or lower cash bond. State objects to bond modification. Court amends to a $1500 cash bond with same conditions plus the condition to pick up personal belongings w/police escort only. Clerk sends petition for court appointed attorney to defendant interoffice w/NOH.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 2, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:33 AM Defendant Benaiah Aaron Appleton appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Shelley Cupino appeared by video for Benaiah Aaron Appleton.  Attorney Claudia T. Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin.
